after_scripts.description: List of commands to execute after the generation is done. Will be executed in the order of the list. Current working directory will be the cloned path. See also "envs" node.

sdkrel:.*.description: All options prefixed by "sdkrel:" can be a relative path that will be solved against SDK folder before being sent to Autorest.

envs.description: Environment variables for after_scripts. All options prefixed by "sdkrel:" can be a relative path that will be solved against SDK folder before being sent to the scripts.

clone_dir.description: Add more layers of folders to clone the repo, if necessary. Right now, useful for Go only. "sdkrel:" will consider this as the final folder path.

markdown.description: This is an optional parameter which specificy the Autorest MD file path for this project. This is relative to the rest-folder paramter.

output_dir.description: This is the folder in your SDK repository where you want to put the generated files.

build_dir.description: This is an optional folder where to put metadata about the generation (Autorest version, date of generation, etc.). This can be used by our monitoring system to detect package that needs an update. Be sure this folder is unique in the entire file, to avoid overwritting a file from another project.

projects.description: It's a dict where keys are a project id. The project id has no constraint, but it's recommended to use namespace style, like "datalake.store.account" to provide the best flexibility for the --project parameter.

verbose.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Show verbose output information.

debug.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Show internal debug information.

quiet.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Suppress output.

list-installed.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Show all installed versions of AutoRest tools.

list-available.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Lists the last nn releases available from github.

version.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Uses specified version of AutoRest (installing if necessary.)
For version you can use a version label (see --list-available) or
-latest: Get latest nightly build.
-latest-release: Get latest release version.

reset.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Remove all installed versions of AutoRest tools and install the latest (override with --version).

runtime-id.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Overrides the platform detection for the dotnet runtime (special case). Refer to the Runtime Identifier (RID) catalog for more details.

input-file.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Adds the given file to the list of input files for generation process.

namespace.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Sets the namespace to use for the generated code.

license-header.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Text to include as a header comment in generated files. Use NONE to suppress the default header.

add-credentials.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
If specified, the generated client includes a ServiceClientCredentials property and constructor parameter. Authentication behaviors are implemented by extending the ServiceClientCredentials type.

package-name.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Name of the package.

package-version.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Version of the package.

sync-methods.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Specifies mode for generating sync wrappers. Supported value are:
essential - generates only one sync returning body or header (default)
all - generates one sync method for each async method
none - does not generate any sync methods

payload-flattening-threshold.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
The maximum number of properties in the request body. If the number of properties in the request body is less than or equal to this value, these properties will be represented as method arguments.

override-client-name.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Name to use for the generated client type. By default, uses the value of the 'Title' field from the input files.

use-internal-constructors.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Indicates whether generated constructors will have an internal protection level.

use-datetimeoffset.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Indicates whether to use DateTimeOffset instead of DateTime to model date-time types.

models-name.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Name to use for the generated client models namespace and folder name. By default, uses the value of 'Models'. This is not currently supported by all code generators.

output-file.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
If set, will cause generated code to be output to a single file. Not supported by all code generators.

message-format.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Specifies the format, messages will be printed as. JSON format is easier to process programmatically.

azure-validator.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
If set, runs the Azure specific validator plugin.

openapi-type.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Indicates the type of configuration file being passed to the azure-validator so that it can run the appropriate class of validation rules accordingly.

model-validator.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
If set, validates the provided OpenAPI definition(s) against provided examples.

semantic-validator.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
If set, semantically verifies the provided OpenAPI definition(s), e.g. checks that a parameter's specified default value matches the parameter's declared type.

csharp.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Runs the C# code generator.

nodejs.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Runs the Node.js JavaScript code generator.

python.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Runs the Python code generator.

java.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Runs the Java code generator.

ruby.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Runs the Ruby code generator.

go.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Runs the Go code generator.

typescript.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Runs the TypeScript code generator.

azureresourceschema.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Runs the Azure Resource Schema code generator.

azure-arm.description:
An option that will be passed to autorest.
Uses the Azure version of the specified code generator.

oneOf.description: An option that will be passed to autorest.
An option that will be passed to autorest.
An option that will be passed to autorest.

autorest_options.description: An optional dictionary of options you want to pass to Autorest. This will be passed in any call, but can be override by "autorest_options" in each data. Note that you CAN'T override "--output-folder" which is filled contextually. All options prefixed by "sdkrel:" can be a relative path that will be solved against SDK folder before being sent to Autorest.

items.description: A file/directory that will be kept from the generated SDK.

wrapper_filesOrDirs.description: An optional list of files/directory to keep when we generate new SDK. This support a Bash-like wildcard syntax (i.e. '*/myfile?.py'). This applies to every Swagger files.

items.description: A file/directory that will be deleted from the generated SDK.

delete_filesOrDirs.description: An optional list of files/directory to delete from the generated SDK. This support a Bash-like wildcard syntax (i.e. '*/myfile?.py') This applies to every Swagger files.

generated_relative_base_directory.description: If the data to consider generated by Autorest are not directly in the root folder. For instance, if Autorest generates a networkclient folder and you want to consider this folder as the root of data. This parameter is applied before 'delete_filesOrDirs', consider it in your paths. This applies to every Swagger files.

sdkrelProperty.description: All options prefixed by "sdkrel:" can be a relative path that will be solved against SDK folder before being sent to Autorest.
